snippet: By building warehouses across the country, the retailer hopes to cut as much as a day off its two-day shipping times.
abstract: Amazon is building warehouses across the country in a bid to improve its shipping service, as it is faces the loss of perhaps its biggest competitive edge--that the vast majority of its customers do not pay sales tax on purchases; online retail giant, which has been forced to begin collecting sales taxes in several states, hopes that a better distribution network will give it the ability to up-end the retailing industry in an entirely new way.

byline.contributor: Nick Bilton contributed reporting from Santa Monica, Calif.

lead_paragraph: By building warehouses across the country, the retailer hopes to cut as much as a day off its two-day shipping times.

headline.seo: Amazon, Forced to Collect Sales Tax, Aims to Keep Its Competitive Edge
headline.main: Amazon, Forced to Collect a Tax, Is Adding Roots
